Member Function Documentation

void IrdaObexImpl::Abort (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  abort_req
)  [virtual]
 

Aborts an ongoing OBEX client operation.

Only a currently pending PUT or GET operation can be aborted, and only clients may issue ABORT requests.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier of the operation to be aborted
abort_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the ABORT request.

Implements ObexLayer.

ObexResult IrdaObexImpl::AcquireClientChannel (  ObexChannel &  result,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr,
BOOLEAN  reserve
)  [virtual]
 

Abstract factory method for client transport channels.

Must be implemented to return a client channel object for the specified protocol. The Channel object must be unique among all channels of the same transport and protocol. However, the under- lying transport service may be shared with other channels.

Parameters:
result Reference to a channel object to hold the result. It will be overwritten in case of success.
reserve If set to TRUE, indicates that private transport resources should be reserved for this channel. However, an implementation may choose to silently ignore this hint.
Returns:
'TRUE' in case of success, ObexResult indicating an error otherwise (possibly lack of resources).

Implements ObexProtocol.

ObexResult IrdaObexImpl::AcquireServerChannel (  ObexChannel &  result,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr,
BOOLEAN  reserve
)  [virtual]
 

Abstract factory method for server transport channels.

Must be implemented to return a server channel object for the specified protocol. The Channel object must be unique among all channels of the same transport and protocol. However, the under- lying transport service may be shared with other channels.

Parameters:
result Reference to a channel object to hold the result. It will be overwritten in case of success.
reserve If set to TRUE, indicates that private transport resources should be reserved for this channel. However, an implementation may choose to silently ignore this hint.
Returns:
'TRUE' in case of success, ObexResult indicating an error otherwise (possibly lack of resources).

Implements ObexProtocol.

void IrdaObexImpl::BindServerChannel (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr
)  [virtual]
 

Binds a server transport channel to an OBEX address.

The channel must have been previously obtained by calling AcquireServerChannel(). After the operation has been completed, an implementation must call OnComplete() to return the result asynchronously.

See also:
OnComplete()
Parameters:
server_chan Server transport channel to open.
oper_id Operation identifier
addr_ptr Smartpointer holding the OBEX address of the service to connect to

Implements ObexProtocol.

void IrdaObexImpl::CloseChannel (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id
)  [virtual]
 

Closes a transport channel.

The channel must have been previously obtained by calling AcquireServerChannel(). After the operation has been completed, an implementation must call OnComplete() to return the result asynchronously.

See also:
OnComplete()
Parameters:
channel Transport channel to close.
oper_id Operation identifier

Implements ObexProtocol.

void IrdaObexImpl::Connect (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  conn_req
)  [virtual]
 

Starts an OBEX CONNECT operation.

The channel must be a valid client channel in state 'OPEN'.

See also:
OpenClientChannel(). The result is delivered asynchronously by means of a call to OnResponse().

OnResponse()

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
conn_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the CONNECT request and flags according to OBEX Spec. 3.3.1.2, but no data !

Implements ObexLayer.

void IrdaObexImpl::DataProcessed (  const ObexChannel &  channel,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
ObexBuffer &  obex_buffer
)  [virtual]
 

Confirm processing of data delivered to an application.

By calling this method the application layer returns the ownership of a buffer back to the protocol implementation which had produced the buffer and therefore knows how to dispose it.

Implements ObexLayer.

void IrdaObexImpl::Disconnect (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  disc_req
)  [virtual]
 

Starts an OBEX DISCONNECT operation.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
disc_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the DISCONNECT request.

Implements ObexLayer.

void IrdaObexImpl::Get (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  get_req
)  [virtual]
 

Starts or continues an OBEX GET operation.

Note that in rare cases a GET request may contain a BODY header !

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier.
get_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the GET request and possibly BODY data within an ObexBuffer.

Implements ObexLayer.

void IrdaObexImpl::OpenClientChannel (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr
)  [virtual]
 

Opens an OBEX client transport channel.

The channel must have been previously obtained by calling AcquireClientChannel(). After the operation has been completed, an implementation must call OnComplete() to return the result asynchronously.

See also:
OnComplete()
Parameters:
obex_chan Channel to open
oper_id Operation identifier
addr_ptr Smartpointer holding the OBEX address of the service to connect to

Implements ObexProtocol.

void IrdaObexImpl::Put (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  put_req
)  [virtual]
 

Starts or continues an OBEX PUT operation.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
put_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the PUT request and possibly BODY data within an ObexBuffer.

Implements ObexLayer.

ObexResult IrdaObexImpl::ReleaseChannel (  ObexChannel &  channel  )  [virtual]
 

Releases an ObexChannel.

Returns:
'TRUE' in case of success, ObexResult indicating an error otherwise.

Implements ObexProtocol.

void IrdaObexImpl::ReturnResponse (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  server_resp
)  [virtual]
 

Sends a response to a client request.

Parameters:
server_chan Server channel associated with the response.
oper_id Operation identifier of the request to respond to (it was passed along with the request).
server_resp OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the response, the response code and possibly BODY data within an ObexBuffer.

Implements ObexLayer.

void IrdaObexImpl::SetPath (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  setp_req
)  [virtual]
 

Starts an OBEX SETPATH operation.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
setp_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the SETPATH request and flags according to OBEX Spec. 3.3.6.1, but no data !

Implements ObexLayer.
